Joe, from your description I am not certain whether you need 
the "rt" (rea=
l-time) part of rtNEAT.  Am I understanding right that 
you are running a s=
eparate evolution population inside each sensor 
node?  Or are all the sens=
or nodes part of one large population?  In 
the latter case, it is more lik=
ely that rtNEAT might help, but there 
are still a lot of issues specific t=
o the domain.  (For example, if 
communication is only local than global va=
riables cannot be 
guaranteed.)  

My guess without a lot of background is =
that this will be a 
difficult domain to fit into rtNEAT's framework.  Howe=
ver, I could 
be wrong as I don't know exactly what would be measured as fi=
tness.

ken
